p: In reaction (63), at 140 °C, 3.4 wt.% of hydrogen was released. 2.6 wt.% of hydrogen was re-adsorbed at 145 °C and 100 bar. However, no direct hydrogenation from YH 3 +Al at 145 °C and 100 bar occurred [ 240]. Y(AlH 4) 3, and YAlH 6 are reported as amorphous materials [ 240]. However, no direct evidence of YAlH 6 was presented [ 240]; thus, further characterizations of these materials are needed.
